00001 #ifndef TERRAIN_LAND_FACTORY_H
00002 #define TERRAIN_LAND_FACTORY_H
00003 
00004 #include <mangle/stream/stream.hpp>
00005 
00006 namespace Terrain
00007 {
00008   enum LandInfoGridType
00009     {
00010       LGT_Quadratic
00011     };
00012 
00013   enum LandInfoDataType
00014     {
00015       LDT_Float
00016     };
00017 
00018   struct LandInfo
00019   {
00020     // Type information
00021     LandInfoGridType grid;
00022     LandInfoDataType data;
00023 
00024     // Landscape size and number of vertices. Note that xsize and
00025     // ysize may be negative, signaling a flipped landscape in that
00026     // direction.
00027     float xsize, ysize;
00028     int numx, numy;
00029 
00030     // World offset along the same x/y axes. Whether these are set or
00031     // used depends on the client implementation.
00032     float xoffset, yoffset;
00033   };
00034 
00035   /* We use normal streams for data. This allows us to just pass (for
00036      example) a file stream as height map input later, with no extra
00037      fuzz.
00038    */
00039   typedef Mangle::Stream::StreamPtr LandDataPtr;
00040 
00041   /*
00042     Factory class that provides streams to land data cells. Each
00043     "cell" has a unique integer coordinate in the plane.
00044   */
00045   struct LandFactory
00046   {
00047     // True if this factory has any data for the given grid cell.
00048     virtual bool has(int x, int y) = 0;
00049 
00050     // Return stream to data for this cell. Additional data about the
00051     // landscape is returned through the LandInfo struct.
00052     virtual LandDataPtr get(int x, int y, LandInfo &info) = 0;
00053   };
00054 }
00055 #endif
